objtitle.title: *The Great Red Dragon and the Woman Clothed with the Sun: "The Devil is Come Down"*

objdescid.origination: Anonymous delineator. The inscriptions on the mount (the backing mat) are not by Blake. They could not have been written before 1846, the earliest known date for the production of the paper on which the inscriptions are written. The identity of the calligrapher who wrote the inscriptions is not known.
objdescid.compdate: c. 1805 The mount (the backing mat) is probably a type of Turnbull's Crayon Board not produced until 1846.

objinfo.objsize: 40.8 x 33.7 cm. The mount (the backing mat) measures 50.8 x 35.0 cm.
objinfo.leafsize: 40.8 x 33.7 cm. The mount (the backing mat) measures 50.8 x 35.0 cm.
objinfo.medium: pen and ink and water color The inscriptions on the mount (the backing mat) are in pen and ink.
objinfo.support: paper, probably wove The mount (the backing mat) is probably Turnbull's Crayon Board, a card-like paper.

provenance.name: National Gallery of Art, Washington
provenance.note: Commissioned and acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts c. 1805; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold Sotheby's, 26 March 1852, lot 163, titled "The Devil is come down" as in the inscription on the mount above the design (£1.15s. to the dealer Henry G. Bohn); E. Daniel; sold Christie's, 1 June 1887, lot 262, titled "Subject from the Revelation of St. John" (£14 to the dealer John Pearson); the dealer Robson and Co.; offered by Robson in his catalogue 63 of 1897 and in a 1904 catalogue (£52.10s.); the dealer Carfax & Co. by 1914; the dealer Thomas Agnew & Sons by 1923; sold by Agnew for $2500 to A. Edward Newton by no later than May 1926; sold from Newton's collection, Parke-Bernet, New York, 16 April 1941, lot 118 ($10,100 to the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach acting for Lessing J. Rosenwald); given by Rosenwald to the National Gallery of Art, Washington, in 1945.

repository.addressline: Constitution Ave. NW, between 3rd and 9th Streets
repository.collection: Lessing J. Rosenwald Collection, National Gallery of Art, Washington

desc.objtitle:
The Great Red Dragon and the Woman Clothed with the Sun: "The Devil is Come Down",
full view including mount inscriptions

objnote.p: Blake signed the work, lower left, with his monogram; see the textual transcription. The inscriptions on the mount (the backing mat) above and below the design are not by Blake.

desc.objtitle:
The Great Red Dragon and the Woman Clothed with the Sun: "The Devil is Come Down",
top mount inscription

objnote.p: The inscription on the mount (the backing mat) above the design is not by Blake.

desc.objtitle:
The Great Red Dragon and the Woman Clothed with the Sun: "The Devil is Come Down",
bottom mount inscriptions

objnote.p: The inscriptions on the mount (the backing mat) below the design are not by Blake.

lg.l:
Re ns 14 th
The mount is badly damaged in the area of this inscription. In addition to the inscriptions we have tentatively transcribed, there are fragments of other letters and/or numbers, presumably all part of a reference to the passage illustrated. Butlin 520 records "Rev ns : ch [...] th 14[?] th ."
And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that
she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, from the face of the
